name: 2-phenylimidazole
Reason: 2-phenylimidazole has a melting point that we can compare to benzene's melting point of 5.5°C. The basic unit for our comparison will be the imidazole ring, which has a melting point of around 10°C due to its rigidity and potential for hydrogen bonding. The phenyl group introduces additional rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +20°C. The presence of two phenyl groups can significantly increase the melting point due to their ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C.
